verses.roman:
ei dui śloka--bhakta-kaṇṭhe ratna-hāra
sārvabhaumera kīrti ghoṣe ḍhakkā-vādyākāra

synonyms: ei dui śloka—these two verses; bhakta-kaṇṭhe—on the necks of the devotees; ratna-hāra—pearl necklaces; sārvabhaumera—of Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭācārya; kīrti—reputation; ghoṣe—declare; ḍhakkā—of a drum; vādya—of the sound; ākāra—in the form.
translation: These two verses composed by Sārvabhauma Bhaṭṭācārya will always declare his name and fame as loudly as a pounding drum because they have become pearl necklaces around the necks of all devotees.
